title: I think the support class/tag should be renamed to distinguish between class and the role
body:
It's not that I think "Support" doesn't fit as a description, but rather that it's a little messy that support is both a role and a class at the moment. A class is meant to be part of a champion's identity, and since Zyra, Leona or others tend to be confused for being supports (because they are or were mostly played in the role of the supporter) I think it may be better to rename the class Sona, Lulu, etc. sit in. If I remember correctly the term Marksman was for the differentiation of role (adc) versus identity as well.

Thoughts?

replies.body:
simple solutiion 
remove the support tag 
add the utility bar on champion's stats panel 

so nami is a mage with high utility
leona is a tank with high utility

while volibear is a tank with lower utility
I don't know about that. I mean you could say every tank is a fighter with high defense (and utility).

but is that utility leona tier ?

for a guy like naut i would agree
but sion rammus and other tanks arent this much about utility
That's why I put it in brackets. Point was I'm not fond of replacing the class with stat measurements.
then i dont think you will find much, because a guy who assists you in combat is your combat support, this name fits the best

I made the suggestion a while too and it wasn't the first.

I'd rename the role though: Assist.

Because the Assist helps the ADC do their job, while a Support does various stuff for the team, they can't do themselves.

At least that's my understanding on how the two terms Assist and Support are defined.
I'm thinking "Aide" would be a better term, because it applies to people.

but if two supports get caught out in the jungle, would that mean someone caught...

NEVERMIND
Yeah that would work too, probably betetr because it doesn't confuse with a kill assist.

The thing is, the roles are made by the players. You can change the tags to show that this support and that support aren't the same thing, but you can't really tell people to not call the role support anymore.

Not sure what I'd rename it, but you have a point. Nunu, for example, can play in the jungle or support position. But as a jungler, he still functions as a team support. He's not ganking and getting kills. He's eating both jungles, stealing dragons, and keeping the map lit up.

Change it to Guardian/Defender/Protector class. Support is a role, not a class. Zyra/Annie/Vel'Koz were not meant to be a support, but just happens to be a mage that goes botlane, while Lulu, even mid, is not picked for her damage but for her support capabilities with higher gold income to better defend a hypercarry and deny enemy snowballers.

> [{quoted}](name=BluePolarizer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=r7QnAPhX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-11T14:45:46.268+0000)
>
> Change it to Guardian/Defender/Protector class. 

Seems like those would imply tankiness though, and tanks already have a class name.  I thought the idea was to have a new class name for the squishier, more mage-like kind of supports, Sona, Soraka, Janna, Nami, Bard etc.  (Not sure which class Lulu would belong to though... she seems kinda ambivalent, like Lux, Kayle, Morgana, Zilean...)

It doesn't really matter, if they rename it now people are just gonna keep calling it by the old name. I've seen very few people refer to 'marksmen' and most of those that do primarily say it to mock the term.

To be fair, marksmen is a big word to type in chat (especially for those who type it really fast then autolock) and adc is just easier. Especially in the fray of a game. Mid, top, adc, bot, jung, people tend to keep to the short versions (tank is reasonably short as well). Not a real easy way to abbreviate marksmen.

As for support...? Unless the new names were short and catchy, I doubt it would catch on.

A *support* (role) is the non-csing partner in a duo lane.

A *utility carry* does little damage, and primarily peels for a damage-dealing carry.

- Since "UC" is kind of a bleh acronym, it could be "Crowd Control Carry," or 3C/TripleC
